p: Finally, any state or federal government stockpiles of critical medications should be mobilized, now, to hospitals experiencing surges in patients. Delay in providing these to cities in need will cause major harm and loss of trust. For critical hospital medications, the government should establish centralized systems to track need based on patient caseload to inform manufacturing requirements, and to shift supply rapidly and equitably. States and cities should be willing to share supplies of vital medications with other states as their own needs diminish when disease control is achieved within the state.
